jobText: TXT/50541542.txt	§Loss Adjustor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Loss Adjustor§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Competiitve salary with loads of benefits!§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§ §Gallagher Bassett is New Zealand’s premier third party administrator (TPA).  We manage group insurance plans and claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured organisations.  We are part of the leading global risk management and insurance group Arthur J Gallagher & Co, and awarded one of the Top 15 Best Employers in the NZ Insurance Industry 2020.§ §Through a team geographically dispersed throughout New Zealand, GB provides a suite of claims management, risk management and related services out of offices located in Auckland, Christchurch, and Dunedin.§ § § § We are proud to be one of 124 companies from 19 countries on 5 continents, named on the Ethisphere Institute’s 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies list for the ninth consecutive year.§ § § §The Role § § § §We have a fantastic opportunity for a Loss Adjuster within our General Insurance team. We are looking for someone who can assist with us with assessments across a range of New Zealand’s leading insurers. You will also have the opportunity to take an active role in the continuous improvement of processes within the business.§ § § §Responsibilities include but are not limited to:§ § §§Conduct onsite assessments to establish cause and quantum of insurance claims; including commercial, domestic and event.§Maintaining a full understanding of policies, processes and systems;§Be able to understand and interpret insurance policies across a range of products§Engage and manage specialists as and when required, including reviewing reports and providing instruction or progressing the claim§Compile high quality detailed scope of works, loss schedules and photographic evidence§Actively contributing to initiatives and driving growth or improvement, both personally and across the organisation;§The role is Auckland based within our CBD office. We are looking for someone with a commitment to high standards of customer service, has a sense of personal responsibility for resolving issues, empowering yourself and your colleagues to exceed customer expectations.§§ § §The Right Person § § § §Ideally, you will have:  § §§Experience in general insurance loss adjusting;§Minimum 5 years of work experience;§Experience/knowledge of the building/construction industry;§Understanding of Health & Safety requirements§Communication effectiveness / demonstrated high-level interpersonal skills;§Demonstrated time-management, organisational and negotiation skills;§Demonstrated computer literacy i.e. Microsoft Office Suite; ability to learn new systems;§Enthusiasm and initiative, with the willingness to contribute to a dynamic, professional and positive team environment§§ §Benefits & Culture§ §When you join the Gallagher Bassett team, you’ll be joining a culture of best practice, partnership, success and fun! Every member of our team is highly skilled, with a passion for what we do! We work collaboratively to deliver meaningful and relevant services to our clients, and to ensure a consistently high level of job satisfaction among our team members.§Life at Gallagher Bassett is often fast-paced, unpredictable and challenging. Our work is deeply rewarding, social and engaging.§ §Some of our benefits include:§ §Attractive remuneration package§Ongoing professional development§Employee referral incentive§Employee Wellness Program§Employee Assistance Program (for yourself and immediate family members)  § §If you’re looking to step into a great career with a progressive company – we look forward to hearing from you. § §Apply now! § §Click on Apply for this Job.§ §Only people with the right to work in this country will be considered for this position.§ §Applications from agencies will not be accepted.§ §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50550353.txt	§Claims Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Advisor§§Advertiser: §Zurich Financial Services Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Claims Advisor §      §Claims Advisor – Financial Lines § §        §Are you an experienced Claims Advisor or Solicitor with a passion for delivering results? Do you thrive in an environment where your skills and expertise gains respect from your colleagues? If so, then this opportunity may be for you. § §        §The overall objective of the role is to ensure that claims are handled in the most efficient, effective way while delivering a customer-centric claims service. Reporting to the Financial Lines Claims Manager, the role will see you providing market leading, timely, effective and cost efficient management of a portfolio of Financial Lines Claims including claims relating to directors & officers, crime, cyber, management liability, employment practices liability, and professional indemnity.§        §        §You will be required to manage claims, evaluate claims and defence costs reserves based on your analysis of liability and quantum. You will be working closely with underwriters, brokers and insured's to pursue the best possible resolution strategy. You would also be responsible for forging strong relationships with a number of stakeholders both within and outside of Zurich, therefore will possess superior communications skills, both written and verbal. §        §        §To be successful in this role you will have sound insurance knowledge and experience; knowledge relevant legislation and regulations governing General Insurance practices. Additionally, you will possess 2+ years legal experience, preferably in civil law litigation (particularly Directors & Officers/PI) and/or 3+ years financial lines/specialty insurance experience such as directors & officers, professional indemnity, employment practices, cyber, management liability, and crime insurance.§ §        §As a long-standing player in the insurance industry, we make every effort to address the career development needs and plans of our employees to ensure their success in the future.§ §        §So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported. Love what you do. Work for us. Apply Today!§        § §      §      §        §        § Please click the 'Apply for this job' button below to submit your application§      §    §    §www.zurich.com.au§  §§§Claims Advisor – Financial Lines § §Are you an experienced Claims Advisor or Solicitor with a passion for delivering results? Do you thrive in an environment where your skills and expertise gains respect from your colleagues? If so, then this opportunity may be for you. § §The overall objective of the role is to ensure that claims are handled in the most efficient, effective way while delivering a customer-centric claims service. Reporting to the Financial Lines Claims Manager, the role will see you providing market leading, timely, effective and cost efficient management of a portfolio of Financial Lines Claims including claims relating to directors & officers, crime, cyber, management liability, employment practices liability, and professional indemnity.§§You will be required to manage claims, evaluate claims and defence costs reserves based on your analysis of liability and quantum. You will be working closely with underwriters, brokers and insured's to pursue the best possible resolution strategy. You would also be responsible for forging strong relationships with a number of stakeholders both within and outside of Zurich, therefore will possess superior communications skills, both written and verbal. §§To be successful in this role you will have sound insurance knowledge and experience; knowledge relevant legislation and regulations governing General Insurance practices. Additionally, you will possess 2+ years legal experience, preferably in civil law litigation (particularly Directors & Officers/PI) and/or 3+ years financial lines/specialty insurance experience such as directors & officers, professional indemnity, employment practices, cyber, management liability, and crime insurance.§ §As a long-standing player in the insurance industry, we make every effort to address the career development needs and plans of our employees to ensure their success in the future.§ §So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported. Love what you do. Work for us. Apply Today!§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50563427.txt	§Junior Broker, SME Team - 12 Month fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Broker, SME Team - 12 Month fixed term§§Advertiser: §Aon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Responsibilities§ § § §The Opportunity § § § §Our Wellington SME Team is looking for a Junior Broker to join their dynamic team on a fixed term basis.  § § § §We are looking for a proactive individual who will take ownership of a SME book of business. With your ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment you will also administer documentation between clients and insurers and prepare premium calculations. § § § §Ideally you will have had a few years’ experience in a similar role or industry where you have demonstrated the ability to perform under pressure and provide exceptional client service.  § § § § § §Furthermore, you will:  § §Provide professional, accurate and efficient response to client needs through liaison with clients and underwriters § §Provide professional, accurate documentation to both clients and insurers § §Maintain up-to-date client files § §From time to time may be required to perform other duties within the normal business activities of the company § § § §  § §About §Y§ou§ § §  § §To hit the ground running in this role you will need to come from a similar role where you have managed a book of business, and ideally have experience within the Insurance knowledge. There is lots of autonomy in this position, so you will be a proactive person who uses their initiative to always be one step ahead.  § §  § §Ideally you will have the following skillset: § §Prior insurance / broking experience within a similar role or area of insurance that provides a basic understanding of our industry § §Experience building and maintaining relationships with clients  § §Confidence being a point of contact when needed § §Strong written and verbal communication skills § §Hard working, a team player and have the ability to juggle multiple tasks.  § § §Aon Culture & Benefits§ § § § § §At Aon, we provide colleagues with the support to make a positive impact together with ongoing opportunities for development, including the support of a team which will continually inspire you to achieve the best.  § §  § §We currently have approximately 850 employees in New Zealand. Globally, we have an employee base of 50,000 people, working across 120 countries. This allows us to build the best teams and gather the best thinking from around the world to deliver quality solutions and service locally. § §  § §To be eligible to apply you must have NZ working rights and be currently residing in New Zealand. § §  § §Aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.§ § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50572387.txt	§Broker Support / Account Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Broker Support / Account Executive§§Advertiser: §O'Connor Warren Insurance Brokers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§About the business§ § §O'Connor Warren Insurance Brokers is a family owned Tauranga based business. We provide fire & general insurance broking services to a client base spread across the country. Put simply, we are nationally focussed, specialist insurance brokers with a passion for client service and satisfaction. Our experience and expertise in the industry segments in which we choose to do business are unrivalled.§ §We won the 2018 Small to Medium Broking Company of the Year and were runners up in the Young Insurance Profesionals Employer of the Year.§ § §About the role§ § §The role will involve working closely with the Director to service our most important clients and has a high degree of autonomy. The role is varied with opportunities to develop a wide skillset and build relationships with clients and within the sector. § §The successful candidate will become a registered financial advisor if they are not already Level 5 qualified under the new FMA scheme. Ongoing training opportunities are also provided by way of webinars and other industry specific training. For the right individual there is a genuine opportunity to progress in the company quickly.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §We are a small and dynamic team, with a 'work hard, play hard' culture.  We encourage and support our team to have a healthy balanced lifestyle and offer a number of benefits to support this.   § §We work closely as a team.  The opportunity to learn and develop in this role is exponential.§ §We are based in the Tauranga CBD with great access to public transport.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §Whilst we would prefer you to have insurance experience, this may not be necessary dependent on your ability to learn on the job and any transferrable skills. § §It is very important that you demonstrate a strong work ethic, are passionate about your work, are motivated and have excellent relationship/communication skills including a great sense of humour!§ §Key attributes that we are looking for:§• Excellent communication skills – both written & verbal§• Relationship building and communication skills – strong ability to connect with people§• To be nimble and be able to think on their feet§• An eye for detail§• Ability to work under pressure§• Excellent computer skills§• A 'work hard – play hard' attitude§• The applicant must have obtained a minimum of NCEA Level 2  an excellent high school attendance record§ § § §Please apply with your CV and Cover Letter. § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of claims management processes?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your highest level of education?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We would like this position to be filled with someone more long-term goal oriented, that is truly interested in working in the industry and helping people to protect their loved ones.  You will learn the financial services industry with ongoing training. This is a truly unique learning and career advancement opportunity for those interested in getting into the field.§  §Please note that only successful applicants will be notified.  §Please only apply if you are immediately available or require less than 2 weeks notice. At the heart of Partners Life is a desire to get everyday Kiwi’s covered and covered properly. We will continue to innovate and raise both our standards and as a result, the entire industry’s.  Never afraid to ruffle feathers, we have always said we’d do things differently – and we do.  We have a clear strategy to set ourselves apart from competitors by being bold and challenging the conventional traditions of our industry.§        §We’re at an exciting juncture in our 9-year history, and this is where these roles come in.  We are currently looking for a new person to join our Actuarial team as an Actuary.§        §In this role you will be involved in:§        §          §Running and maintaining actuarial models§          §Regular reviewing of actuarial modelling assumptions§          §Reporting of business performance against assumptions§          §Pricing§          §Solvency§        §        §As well as these specific tasks, you will also be part of a highly motivated team and be involved in other areas of the business as the need arises.§        §So, what are we looking for?§        §          §You will be an Actuary who has recently qualified, or has up to 5 years experience post qualification§          §You will have previous experience in Life Insurance§          §Experience with Prophet is desirable§          §A good communicator, both verbally and in writing§          §Proficient skills in Microsoft Office§          §Analytical thinking§          §Ability to problem solve§        §        §These opportunities don’t come up often, so don’t miss your chance!§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§From the get-go, Partners Life’s focus has been to protect Kiwis and the things that matter most to them.  Far too many Kiwis float through life unprepared for a possible interruption. At the heart of Partners Life is a desire to get everyday Kiwi’s covered and covered properly. jobTitle: Senior Manager Risk Frameworks Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50621701.txt	§Senior Manager Risk Frameworks§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Manager Risk Frameworks§§Advertiser: §AIA New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to help people live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our Operating Philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§§The Opportunity at AIA§As a Senior Manager Risk Frameworks you’ll report to the Head of Risk Governance & Strategy and will be responsible for leading the development and embedment of the risk management framework at AIA. You’ll provide governance, consultative and advisory services that support management in effectively identifying, monitoring and managing risks that impact on business objectives§§Key responsibilities are to:§§Lead the review and update of AIA’s core foundational risk policies to ensure ongoing compliance, and alignment with Group requirements§Prepare analysis and papers to support policy and framework governance approvals§Maintain a compliant AIA Risk Management Programme and ensure governance requirements are met§Lead the AIANZ completion of the annual Risk Management and Control Certification (RMCC) Lead complate attestation process§Lead the review and approval of key risk committee terms of reference§Coordinate implementation and maintenance AIA’s policy programme including oversight and reporting over policy reviews and managing an effective policy exemption framework,§Manage the design and processes to support a current and complete policy repository. §Facilitate the development of the risk team strategic plan§Develop and deliver training and guidance to support framework implementation and adherence§Contribute to the delivery of risk projects and internal initiatives.§Actively contribute to the identification, development and implementation of risk strategies to enable the organisation to achieve its goals.§Be a key point of contact for risk management framework queries.§Liaise with key stakeholders and other stakeholders to ensure a consistent approach to risk framework development and implementation.§Support the risk input into the AIA NZ Strategic Planning Process.§Develop and maintain collaborative internal and external partnerships to leverage the three lines of defence.§Collaborate and influence across all levels to support the implementation of the risk management framework, and the risk team strategy. Prepare papers for Executive and Board meetings.§Identify and undertake personal and professional development for self and contribute to the development of the wider team.§Perform and support other initiatives as required to support the Head of Risk Governance and Strategy.§§Skills and experience required:§Superior relationship management experience, with a proven ability to develop deep relationships at all levels internally and externally.§Excellent verbal and written communication skills§Experience working with Executives and comfort in dealing with all senior leaders.§Excellent negotiation and influencing skills.§Strong risk management skills and experience.§Excellent organisational and planning skills.§Proactive and focused on continual improvement.§Financial or insurance services knowledge & experience.§Ability to meet critical timeframes and deadlines.§Proven change and project management skills.§Extensive experience in risk management, audit or financial services background.§Proven ability to develop relationships with a variety of stakeholders, including those with divergent interest§Relevant Tertiary qualification preferable.§§Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership.  § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.  We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves.  We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§§You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.§§§§§

A multi-year Risk Transformation Program (rQ) is in place to fundamentally transform IAG's approach to managing risk across the Group. It is designed to accelerate the development of IAG's risk capability and capacity to meet increasing community, regulatory and stakeholder expectations.§        §The role of Consultant, Risk Assurance within our Risk & Strategy function will perform an extensive range of controls assurance activities that supports an improvement over our control environment. We offer the freedom to work in a flexible environment, respect and encourage diversity and as an international company we offer opportunities for training and career advancement.§We care about delivering brilliant experiences to customers and are focussed on action rather than theory. Our team is afforded autonomy and accountability in their day to day work. On offer is a competitive remuneration package, CBD location and modern workspace.§Some of our other benefits are:§§Free life, salary continuance and trauma insurance cover§Discounts on Asteron Life, Vero, Southern Cross medical insurance§Flexible leave of up to four days per year in addition to annual leave§$250 annually for gym membership or hobbies§§For a full range of our benefits please visit §https://www.suncorp.co.nz/careers.html§If this role sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50646653.txt	§Risk and Compliance Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Risk and Compliance Manager§§Advertiser: §Aon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§Responsibilities§ §Be a subject matter expert for operational risk and compliance matters within Aon§ §Work with senior leadership across all business units§ §Provide high quality advice, guidance and recommendations on the management of internal risk matters for Aon§ §The Opportunity:§A unique opportunity has arisen for a Risk and Compliance Manager to join our Auckland CBD Head Office within our Legal and Compliance Team.  § The NZ Legal and Compliance Team provides expert, timely, comprehensive and solutions-focused legal and compliance services to the Aon NZ and Fiji businesses and also provides local regulatory and global compliance support.  § With the support of the Australian legal and compliance team, this role will work closely with our business stakeholders, interacting with senior leaders on a regular basis, providing advice and driving compliance in a way that ensures the effective operation of the business. § §You should possess the following:§ §Experience within a similar role, preferably within the Financial Services sector§ §Work experience should show depth in a combined risk and compliance role§ §Be solutions-focused with the ability to manage competing interests§ §A strong commitment to organisation goals, and a high level of ethics and integrity§ §Be commercially astute, client-focused and have experience in a corporate environment with a proven ability to liaise with all levels of seniority§ §Be highly flexible and adaptable, be comfortable with change and ambiguity and be able to manage conflicts.§ §This is an exciting and challenging role that offers a highly supportive and collaborative team environment with the opportunity to be part of a dynamic and highly performing organisation.§ § § §Aon Benefits and Culture§ §At Aon, we provide colleagues with the support to make a positive impact together with ongoing opportunities for development, including the support of a team which will continually inspire you to achieve the best.§ § §We currently have approximately 900 employees in New Zealand. Globally, we have an employee base of 50,000 people, working across 120 countries. This allows us to build outstanding teams and gather the best thinking from around the world to deliver quality solutions and service locally.§ § § §About Aon§ §Aon Risk Solutions is a multi-faceted retail broking and risk management service that specialises in providing products, services, and solutions to meet the diverse and varied needs of our clients. We help our clients anticipate the obstacles that stand in the way of achieving their business vision by providing innovative, effective solutions that help clear the path to their success. Our clients range from multi-national companies to individuals who use our expertise to manage their own personal financial risks.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50647979.txt	§Risk & Insurance Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Risk & Insurance Specialist§§Advertiser: §Aon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Risk Consulting§§§§§§Responsibilities§ §Infrastructure Risk and Insurance Specialist | Auckland§ § § §Join a successful, growing team working at the leading edge of insurance § §Opportunity to partner with industry experts and work with both local and international insurers § §A unique role that will combine your broking / risk management skills with technical experts to provide global leading risk mitigation and business resilience solutions§ §Based in Auckland CBD head office§ § § §The Opportunity§ §As a risk and insurance specialist you will have experience servicing large organisations, working with quality professionals (including valuers and engineers) to provide optimal risk mitigation and risk financing solutions.  Along with client servicing, you will be expected to develop the business and drive client value.§ § § §This unique position will leverage your understanding of organisational risks, particularly around mitigating the impacts of natural disasters and enhancing resilience for clients.  You will be interacting with a variety of government entities across New Zealand to help develop effective risk mitigation solutions and create more resilient communities.§ § § §This is a fantastic opportunity for you to grow and build on your risk management experience in a specialist space that is rapidly evolving. As part of the Aon team, you will work with and have exposure to numerous specialist practices locally and globally. § § § §To be successful in this role, you should have: § § §Proven experience in a risk management, technical broking or insurance role § §Experience and/or understanding in engineering, broking and underwriting § §Understanding of infrastructure risks and interest in natural hazards§ §High-calibre negotiation and influencing skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders§ §An ability to identify practical and financial controls that can be implemented to minimise identified risks § §Strong communication skills and confidence in dealing with senior stakeholders across various practices § §Ability to travel around New Zealand§ § § §Aon Benefits and Culture§ §At Aon, we provide colleagues with the support to make a positive impact together with ongoing opportunities for development, including the support of a team which will continually inspire you to achieve the best. § §We currently have approximately 1,000 employees in New Zealand. Globally, we have an employee base of 50,000 people, working across 120 countries. This allows us to build outstanding teams and gather the best thinking from around the world to deliver quality solutions and service locally.§ § §How to Apply§ § § §Make your mark and apply here! Position description available upon request.§ § § § §About Aon§ §Aon Risk Solutions is a multi-faceted retail broking and risk management service that specialises in providing products, services, and solutions to meet the diverse and varied needs of our clients. We help our clients anticipate the obstacles that stand in the way of achieving their business vision by providing innovative, effective risk management solutions that help clear the path to their success. Our clients include national and local government, large multi-national companies, local companies, specialist organisations, rural businesses and individuals.§§§§

At least 3 years claims experience is essential for this role, with an excellent understanding of insurance claims discipline, debt recovery and supporting processes.§        §Helping our business grow and succeed in a challenging and changing environment, you’ll be responsible for:§        §          §Management of third-party recoveries in accordance with best practice and delegated authority limits;§          §Provide support and guidance for our customers;§          §Maintaining and proactively looking to develop internal and external partnerships and relationships to ensure a positive Ando experience for our customers, stakeholders and partners;§          §Identify opportunity to improve processes and systems.§        §        §​Our customers are at the heart of everything we do at Ando. You’ll need a commitment to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and a desire to make the complex seem simple. This role will give you the opportunity to challenge and develop your knowledge in an environment that encourages flexibility and forward thinking.§        §The environment at Ando is fast paced and ever changing, and great opportunities lie ahead for the right candidate. Are you up for the challenge?§        §If this role sounds like you, please hit apply now!§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§At Ando, we're taking a fresh approach to the way insurance works in New Zealand.§  §We have an exciting opportunity for a self-motivated Claims Recoveries Consultant to join our team, managing a portfolio of recovery claims files across both commercial and domestic lines. At least 3 years claims experience is essential for this role, with an excellent understanding of insurance claims discipline, debt recovery and supporting processes.§  §Helping our business grow and succeed in a challenging and changing environment, you’ll be responsible for:§ § §Management of third-party recoveries in accordance with best practice and delegated authority limits;§ §Provide support and guidance for our customers;§ §Maintaining and proactively looking to develop internal and external partnerships and relationships to ensure a positive Ando experience for our customers, stakeholders and partners;§ §Identify opportunity to improve processes and systems.§ §​Our customers are at the heart of everything we do at Ando. You’ll need a commitment to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and a desire to make the complex seem simple. This role will give you the opportunity to challenge and develop your knowledge in an environment that encourages flexibility and forward thinking.§  §The environment at Ando is fast paced and ever changing, and great opportunities lie ahead for the right candidate. Are you up for the challenge?§  §If this role sounds like you, please hit apply now!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have as a claims consultant?§§§

jobTitle: Customer Service Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50658448.txt	§Customer Service Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Consultant§§Advertiser: §Hays Talent Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§Competitive salary with great benefits§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Customer Service Consultant §      §        §Suncorp is an organisation committed to our people, we have a culture where leaders are empowered to make decisions and individuals are able to succeed in a supportive environment that rewards both team work and ambition. Are you looking for that next career move and want to continue being part of the Suncorp success story?§        §An exciting opportunity is available within our Life team, to provide an excellent customer experience within an extremely fast-paced, inbound contact centre environment. At Suncorp, we believe in being brilliant in the moments that matter, and customer service is at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you will be effectively managing customer queries and look for opportunities to go above and beyond their expectations.§        §Key responsibilities§:§        §          §Provide a professional, efficient and responsive service to our customers.§          §Meet the needs of customers and look for opportunities to exceed their expectations and provide solutions to meet their needs.§          §Build positive relationships with internal and external customers.§          §Pursue First Call Resolution by fully utilising product and process knowledge skills Use call control and service techniques to help & support our customers§          §Contribute to the overall continuous improvement of the Contact Centre by proactively making suggestions.§          §Effectively resolve customer enquiries through a multitude of platforms including over the phone, live chat, email and social media §        §        §What we are looking for:§        §          §At least 18 months experience in a fast-paced customer service role – ideally in a first-line, contact centre environment§          §Exceptional phone skills and a passion for helping people over the phone§          §Solution focused with strong problem-solving abilities§          §Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written§          §Strong attention to detail and positive attitude§          §Flexible and resilient with the ability to cope under pressure§          §Comfortable using multiple company, supplier and technology systems§        §        §Hours§        §This is a part-time position, working 22.5 hours per week. You must be available §Monday§, §Thursday§ and §Friday§ each week to work rotating shifts between the operating hours of 8am-6pm. §        §Our Benefits§        §          §Free life, salary continuance and trauma insurance cover§          §Discounted insurance through Vero, Asteron Life and Southern Cross§          §Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance§          §Numerous discounts with our corporate partners (retail & shopping / travel & holiday / health & wellbeing)§          §We offer support and various programs for our people: Employee Assistance Program (EAP), $250 annually towards Health & Wellbeing, Study Support, Employee Referral Program ($600), Company share options, Years of Service Recognition, etc.)§        §        §About Us§        §Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. In New Zealand, we offer insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands Vero and Asteron Life.§        §Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.§        §If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today. For further information please visit our careers website: §https://www.suncorp.co.nz/careers.html§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Suncorp is an organisation committed to our people, we have a culture where leaders are empowered to make decisions and individuals are able to succeed in a supportive environment that rewards both team work and ambition. Are you looking for that next career move and want to continue being part of the Suncorp success story?§An exciting opportunity is available within our Life team, to provide an excellent customer experience within an extremely fast-paced, inbound contact centre environment. At Suncorp, we believe in being brilliant in the moments that matter, and customer service is at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you will be effectively managing customer queries and look for opportunities to go above and beyond their expectations.§Key responsibilities§:§§Provide a professional, efficient and responsive service to our customers.§Meet the needs of customers and look for opportunities to exceed their expectations and provide solutions to meet their needs.§Build positive relationships with internal and external customers.§Pursue First Call Resolution by fully utilising product and process knowledge skills Use call control and service techniques to help & support our customers§Contribute to the overall continuous improvement of the Contact Centre by proactively making suggestions.§Effectively resolve customer enquiries through a multitude of platforms including over the phone, live chat, email and social media §§What we are looking for:§§At least 18 months experience in a fast-paced customer service role – ideally in a first-line, contact centre environment§Exceptional phone skills and a passion for helping people over the phone§Solution focused with strong problem-solving abilities§Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written§Strong attention to detail and positive attitude§Flexible and resilient with the ability to cope under pressure§Comfortable using multiple company, supplier and technology systems§§Hours§This is a part-time position, working 22.5 hours per week. You must be available §Monday§, §Thursday§ and §Friday§ each week to work rotating shifts between the operating hours of 8am-6pm. §Our Benefits§§Free life, salary continuance and trauma insurance cover§Discounted insurance through Vero, Asteron Life and Southern Cross§Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance§Numerous discounts with our corporate partners (retail & shopping / travel & holiday / health & wellbeing)§We offer support and various programs for our people: Employee Assistance Program (EAP), $250 annually towards Health & Wellbeing, Study Support, Employee Referral Program ($600), Company share options, Years of Service Recognition, etc.)§§About Us§Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. In New Zealand, we offer insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands Vero and Asteron Life.§Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.§If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today. For further information please visit our careers website: §https://www.suncorp.co.nz/careers.html§§§§

We’re always looking for new ways to do more and to be better, and that means hiring the best people.§        §This is a great entry level management opportunity for an experienced SME Commercial Underwriter to step up into managing a team. Reporting to the Underwriting Operations Manager, we are looking for someone dynamic to:§        §          §Effectively lead, manage, motivate and relate to a diverse group of SME commercial underwriters with different levels of experience.§          §Be responsible for the ongoing training and development of the team§          §Be the teams ‘go to’ subject matter expert who assists with the more unusual underwriting requests and finding ways to make them work§        §        §Crombie Lockwood is New Zealand’s largest Insurance Broker, providing innovative insurance solutions for our Brokers and Clients. Our team is an Underwriting Agency that achieves Crombie Lockwood’s aspiration and commitment by providing expert knowledge and solutions on behalf of our Underwriting partners.§        §Based in our Auckland Office, the role will work closely with Brokers, Group Business Managers and Technical Managers.  Through strong leadership and professionalism, the SMARTpak Underwriting Team Leader will be instrumental in developing and maintaining SMARTpak’s continued growth, developing reputation as a product and status in the industry and market place.  §        §If you are our next success story - you’ll have:§        §          §More than 5 years F&G commercial underwriting experience and the ability to deal with complex SME accounts§          §Excellent working knowledge of underwriting practices and relevant legislation§          §As a relationship person, you’ll understand the value of positive, constructive and honest communication§          §Experience developing new and existing business opportunities§          §Second to none self-management, efficiency and quality service\§          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand§          §ANZIIF Associate level qualification (required) with a Senior Associate level qualification (preferable)§        §        §At Crombie Lockwood we work hard and celebrate success. We are absolutely focused on doing the right thing for our clients and we strive to provide exceptional service at all times.  §        §Take the next step up in your career and click 'Apply Now'.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§At Crombie Lockwood success doesn’t just happen, we make it happen – for us, our customers and for the great people who work here. Our team is an Underwriting Agency that achieves Crombie Lockwood’s aspiration and commitment by providing expert knowledge and solutions on behalf of our Underwriting partners.§ §Based in our Auckland Office, the role will work closely with Brokers, Group Business Managers and Technical Managers.  Through strong leadership and professionalism, the SMARTpak Underwriting Team Leader will be instrumental in developing and maintaining SMARTpak’s continued growth, developing reputation as a product and status in the industry and market place.  § §If you are our next success story - you’ll have:§ § §More than 5 years F&G commercial underwriting experience and the ability to deal with complex SME accounts§ §Excellent working knowledge of underwriting practices and relevant legislation§ §As a relationship person, you’ll understand the value of positive, constructive and honest communication§ §Experience developing new and existing business opportunities§ §Second to none self-management, efficiency and quality service\§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand§ §ANZIIF Associate level qualification (required) with a Senior Associate level qualification (preferable)§ §At Crombie Lockwood we work hard and celebrate success. jobText: TXT/50661948.txt	§Insurance and Project Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance and Project Support§§Advertiser: §Carpet Court NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§At Carpet Court, we are proud to be New Zealand’s flooring leader – supplying Kiwi’s across the country with the best products, advice and service (not to mention having a pretty awesome Rhino for our mascot). We work hard to stay above the market in design trends, product innovation and outstanding customer service, and we love to celebrate this success across our teams. We are in the process of implementing a new insurance portal to manage claims from registration through to settlement, you will help to manage the roll out and be the key point of contact as this is integrated countrywide. This position requires a flexibility and willingness to undertake other tasks as required to support the store’s achievement of goals and targets.§ § As Insurance and Project Support, you will guide and provide advice to customers on making claims and explain the process involved. You will have a great understanding of the urgency for processing claims in a timely, professional manner. Some nationwide travel will be required for this role as we conduct training on our new insurance portal.§ §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Collect accurate information and documentation to proceed with a claim§ §Help manage the implementation of our new insurance portal§ §Review customer’s policy to ensure coverage of claim§ §Contact appropriate Carpet Court store and arrange for them to make repairs on the customers property§ §Monitor the progress of a claim to ensure stores meet their KPI’s and follow up when necessary with the Customer, or Carpet Court Store§ §Manage any complaints associated with claims§ §Identify reasons behind full payment not being made§ §Weekly calls with insurance teams nationwide§ §Ensure fair settlement of a valid claim§ §Investigate potential fraudulent claims§ §Complete monthly insurance reports and weekly invoices§ §   § §You will have:§ § §Previous work experience in similar business administration environment/position§ §Previous experience in Insurance and/or Customer Service based environment§ §Previous work experience in Insurance and knowledge of the Insurance Claims Process§ §High levels of computer literacy, specifically in Microsoft Office Suite§ §Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities§ §A strong attitude to learning new skills and systems§ §The ability to prioritise and work to tight deadlines, while retaining accuracy and attention to detail§ §Demonstrative flexibility, adaptability and high levels of resilience§ § We are proud to have an inclusive team culture and support growth and development throughout the business making Carpet Court a great place to bring your current skills and pick up a few more on the way!§ What are you waiting for? §Apply today!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50666013.txt	§Commercial Broker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Broker§§Advertiser: §Rothbury Insurance Brokers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§The Company§ §Here at Rothbury we operate a high service model and pride ourselves on providing friendly, helpful and timely advice to our clients. We believe that personal service and quality advice will endure over price!§ §We are dedicated to understanding our clients business and personal insurance needs and then recommending and finding appropriate insurance cover for them in the ever changing market. Once we agree on the best cover possible, we continue to work with our clients as their personal insurance broking resource throughout their insurance cycle.§ §We are a growing company who are committed to developing our people, offering new opportunities and supporting them in their career. We offer a fun and inclusive culture where people enjoy coming to work and know they are valued. We offer;§ § §Competitive salary, KPI’s, commission and profit sharing scheme§ §Wellness days§ §Company funded Health Insurance§ §Career & personal development opportunities.§ §The Role§ §An exciting opportunity has arisen for a motivated and experienced individual to join our Canterbury branch in a Commercial Broker position.§ §The purpose of the Commercial Broker role is to provide our clients with expert advice and tailored insurance policies that suit their individual circumstances and preferences. We work with leading insurance providers which allows us to find the right policy for our clients and their situations. You will manage a portfolio of business clients, where your key focus will be on both the retention and growth of your client base.§ §Key responsibilities will include:§ § §Providing advice, service and insurance assistance to clients§ §Investigating client accounts to ensure appropriate cover is in place§ §Re-marketing client portfolios at renewal and as required§ §Working closely with a broker support to ensure all renewals, new business, alterations and cancellations are processed§ §Growing existing client portfolios by maximising new business opportunities§ §The Ideal Candidate§ §We are seeking a Commercial Insurance Broker to join our Canterbury team. We are looking for:§ § §Fire and General Insurance Broking experience mandatory§ §Experience in sales§ §Strong relationship management and client service skills§ §Strong communication, both verbal and written§ §If this sounds like the right opportunity for you then we would love to hear from you. Please submit both your CV and covering letter today.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years of business development experience do you have?§§§

Underwriter§§Advertiser: §Rosser Underwriting Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Rosser is a well-established and rapidly growing underwriting agency which provides service and support to a large network of insurance brokers throughout New Zealand.§ §We support our customers and suppliers by delivering on our belief that our success is dependent on that of others and seek to outperform the expectations of our broker network and insurers.§ §We are a 30-strong, friendly and energetic team, focused on living up to our service proposition of nimble delivery, integrity and trustworthiness.§ § § § § §About the role§ § § §Our established connections in the broker market seek to place an ever growing range of niche business through Rosser.  The primary purpose of this position is to provide the underwriting expertise to satisfy this demand in the motor and mobile plant market. § §As a key member of our underwriting team you will use your insurance skills, knowledge, experience and expertise to grow and enhance the Rosser brand, whilst at the same time building rapport with and respect from our security providers.§ §Being successful in this role means:§ §you are comfortable working autonomously§are able to, from time to time, travel away from home§you strongly support our team of Development Managers in their efforts to further enhance broker relationships.§ §Using your experience, underwriting and interpersonal skills, the establishment of a sustainable motor division at Rosser is the perfect challenge for you to reach the next step in the development of your insurance career.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §The location of the position is flexible. You can become part of our "cluster" of home-based personnel in Auckland, operate from our Hamilton office, or potentially from a centrally located Auckland CBD office. § §A competitive remuneration package is offered along with the opportunity for upskilling in our diverse insurance business.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §You have had a minimum of three years recent experience in motor and mobile plant underwriting in New Zealand  along with broad knowledge of general insurance functions.§ §You have existing strong relationships within the broker network and wider general insurance industry community as a trusted and respected professional.§ §You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and can clearly communicate with our broker customers and insurer suppliers.  § §Your excellent underwriting and risk management skills enable you to provide smart, sustainable and commercially sound solutions.§ §You have a strong commitment to your professional and personal development, and ideally have qualified as an ANZIIF Associate or Senior Associate.§ §Please address your application including your CV and a cover letter to:§ §Andrew West, Head of Underwriting.§Rosser Underwriting Limited§andrew.west@rosser.co.nz§ §Applications close Sunday 18 October.§ §Any questions? Phone Andrew on 029 969 3848.§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an insurance underwriter?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50679769.txt	§Branch Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Branch Manager§§Advertiser: §Aon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Responsibilities§ §Branch Manager | Gisborne§ §Lead a successful local team and be part of a global business § §Utilise your sales leadership, analytical mindset, and relationship-building skills § §Join a results-driven organisation with the autonomy to grow the business § §  § §The Opportunity§ § §This is an exciting opportunity for a proven Insurance leader to be a part of the Aon business and lead a successful team of Insurance professionals supporting clients within the region. § § § §This role would see you managing a book of clients personally while spearheading new business opportunities for the branch to meet/ exceed annual growth targets. Additionally, you will be responsible for the overall wellbeing and professional development of your team. § § § §This position will have an attractive base salary, vehicle, superannuation, annual discretionary bonus, and unique benefits Aon offer. Please refer to our careers pages for further benefits we offer to all permanent employees.§ § § § § §To be successful in this role, you should have:§ § § §A proven track record within the Insurance industry§ §Experience managing a high-performing sales team§ §Excellent client-relationship building skills § §An analytical mindset and high attention-to-detail for interpreting policies & agreements § §The ability to problem-solve and mitigate risk for clients effectively§ § §Aon Benefits and Culture§ §At Aon, we provide colleagues with the support to make a positive impact together with ongoing opportunities for development, including the support of a team which will continually inspire you to achieve the best. § §We currently have approximately 900 employees in New Zealand. Globally, we have an employee base of 50,000 people, working across 120 countries. This allows us to build outstanding teams and gather the best thinking from around the world to deliver quality solutions and service locally.§ § § §About Aon§ §Aon Risk Solutions is a multi-faceted retail broking and risk management service that specialises in providing products, services, and solutions to meet the diverse and varied needs of our clients. We help our clients anticipate the obstacles that stand in the way of achieving their business vision by providing innovative, effective solutions that help clear the path to their success. Our clients range from multi-national companies to individuals who use our expertise to manage their own personal financial risks.§ § § § §Aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50682101.txt	§Liability Claims Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Liability Claims Consultant§§Advertiser: §FMG§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§As part of our Palmerston North based Claims team, our Liability Claims Consultants are responsible for managing the investigation and assessment of new and existing liability claims. You will be providing advice to client on indemnity, policy coverage, liability and settlement.  Additionally you will also liaise with various internal and external parties to ensure that you are settling claims within policy, FMG guidelines, delegated authorities with the overarching goal of ensuring we are delivering the best claims experience and outcomes for both FMG and our clients. §This role will also be tasked with being a ‘go-to’ for the wider Claims and FMG to assist with learning, up-skilling and personal development in respect to liability claims.  §About you§To be successful in this role, you will:§  §Have had experience in the general insurance industry;§  §Preferably have demonstrated Liability Claims management and/or Litigation experience;§  §Be a great listener and a confident communicator (both verbally and written);§  §Strong critical analysis skills, attention to detail and confident decision maker;§  §Be self-driven with the ability to meet tight deadlines, alongside being able to showcase strong accountability skills and§  §Demonstrated experience in both influencing and building meaningful and strong internal and external relationships.§About FMG§Since 1905, FMG has had its roots firmly planted in rural New Zealand, which is why you’ll find that we're different when it comes to insurance. Now over 100 years later, we’re still 100% New Zealand owned and the country’s leading rural insurance specialist. As a mutual we invest profits back into the business to keep our premiums competitive and continue provide outstanding service for clients. As an employer, we invest in our people to foster a working environment that promotes achievement and celebrates success!§Overall, we are looking for someone who is passionate and excited to be part of a culture that truly values its clients; and wants to play a meaningful part in it!§Application close 5pm, Monday 19th October 2020.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Liability-Claims-Consultant-PD.doc§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50682338.txt	§Recovery Partner, Physical Injury - Henderson§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recovery Partner, Physical Injury - Henderson§§Advertiser: §ACC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§An opportunity to join an organisation that improves lives every day§Providing one to one, holistic, client centred support, to our clients for as long as they may need it§Join an organisation that cares about our employees and is committed to their wellbeing and ongoing development§As a Recovery Partner, employed in our Operations function, you will be responsible for partnering with clients who require a one to one relationship due to their intensive or extensive needs for as long as they need it. You will work in partnership with clients with complex physical, mental health and/or individual needs to provide holistic support during the most critical parts of their recovery.§ACC has been improving the lives of New Zealanders since 1974. With ACC, you'll be supporting people in Aotearoa to stay safe by minimising the incidence and impact of injury, as well as helping them recover from injury if an accident does happen. Join us - an organisation that grew out of bold thinking and has an enduring commitment to care for others at work, home and play.§What we are looking for from you to be successful in these roles:§Proven ability to understand complex customer needs within a multifaceted environment§An ability to take a multi-disciplinary approach, and work as part of a team to rehabilitate clients with complex needs§Personal resilience and ability to deal with challenging information and situations§Proven experience adapting your approach to support different cultural and social backgrounds§Ability to liaise with a wide range of stakeholders, including family/whānau, providers, suppliers and community agencies to ensure a solution focused and coordinated approach and consistency in service§Ability to build rapport and trust and successfully motivate, negotiate and influence outcomes§Previous experience or a qualification in health or social services is desirable§Working at ACC§ §We know that a diverse and inclusive team helps us meet the needs of our customers, and we welcome applications from people of every ethnicity, national origin, gender orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, and/or status as an individual with a disability. It's important to us that people bring their whole selves to work.§To support an inclusive workplace we have the following:§Employee networks:§- Pride@ACC§- Ability@ACC§- Women's Network§- Cross-Cultural Network§ACC's Māori Strategy, Whāia te Tika§Development opportunities in te reo Māori me ngā tikanga§Advocates in the disability sector§Diversity and Inclusion approach§Support Māori by partnering with iwi and other Māori entities.§The indicative salary is $67,087.00 per annum, but this is dependent on your skills and experience We also offer an additional 9% superannuation contribution. Package includes a car and company benefits§ §Be part of a high performing region! § § § §The Opportunity§ § § §Our Hawkes Bay Region is looking to bring on board new §Insurance Brokers/Account Managers§ preferably based in our Napier Branch but open to Hastings Branch as well. jobText: TXT/50692862.txt	§Claims Recovery Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Recovery Consultant§§Advertiser: §FMG§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§FMG are looking for a Claims Recovery Consultant on a 12month fixed term to join our Claims team.§As part of our Palmerston North based Claims team, our Recovery Consultants are tasked with seeking the recovery of third party debt through negotiating with relevant parties to resolve the issues and disputes.  This role will be hands-on in providing effective management of all third party debt recovery processes in the Claims space including repayment options, monitoring of debts as well as proactively engaging in process and system improvements.§About you§To be successful in this role, you will:§  §Has experience or understanding of the general insurance claims process would be preferable;§  §Previous experience in debt recovery would be a significant asset in this role;§  §Willingness to learn and build a working knowledge of the fundamentals of liability and the Disputes Tribunal;§  §Be a great listener and a confident communicator (both verbally and written;§  §Able to demonstrate critical analysis skills, attention to detail and confident decision maker and§  §Be self-driven alongside being able to showcase accountability and strong organisation skills.§About FMG§Since 1905, FMG has had its roots firmly planted in rural New Zealand, which is why you’ll find that we're different when it comes to insurance. Now over 100 years later, we’re still 100% New Zealand owned and the country’s leading rural insurance specialist. As a mutual we invest profits back into the business to keep our premiums competitive and continue provide outstanding service for clients. As an employer, we invest in our people to foster a working environment that promotes achievement and celebrates success!§So go on, make it happen - apply now! Applications close 5pm, Wednesday 21st October 2020.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Claims-Recovery-Consultant-PD.doc§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50697498.txt	§Insurance Broker Support Full-time Perm. #3225§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Broker Support Full-time Perm. #3225§§Advertiser: §Your People Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§$45,000-$50,000 p.a. starting salary§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Insurance Broker Support Full-time Perm. #3225 §        §          §THE COMPANY:§          §Our client is a leading insurance brokerage company that comes under the umbrella of a large multi-national corporation that has been named the world’s most ethical company.§          §You will find that same high standard is consistent company-wide. Our client offers an exceptionally good team culture.§          §THE ROLE:§          §Are you looking to enter into a professional industry that offers an opportunity for career advancement? This Broker Support position provides technical and administrative support to Insurance Brokers, freeing up time for the Brokers to develop and extend their client relationships directly and develop new business.§          §We are looking for an enthusiastic and competent person with loads of initiative to join our client’s busy team in the centre of Dunedin.§          §Preferably, you will either have an insurance or similar background and/or hold a relevant tertiary qualification such as a financial degree. If this is not your background, you will be required to complete a Level 5 qualification while on the job. This role would suit someone with an affinity for numbers and who understands the importance of customer service and compliance.§          §In return for your commitment, my client offers an excellent working environment including staff benefits and supportive management. There is also the potential for transfer opportunities within this global organisation (at a later stage).§          §The Broker Support role is an entry-level office opportunity. In this role you will be learning the ropes of the organisation and its operations, providing support to management, brokers and the wider team as required.§          §This role offers:§          §            §Global opportunities within the organisation§            §Career development opportunities§            §Full time, permanent position§            §Dunedin CBD location§            §Great office and team environment§          §          §RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES INCLUDE:§          §            §No. 1 - support the Brokers/Management§            §Actioning client calls as required§            §New business - preparing underwriter submissions§            §Preparing client reports§            §Canvasing and follow ups§            §Updating and maintaining databases§            §Assist Broker with insurance certificates§            §Assist Broker with endorsements§            §Follow up marketing drops§            §Follow up outstandings§            §Providing administrative/technical support§            §Client visits for Broker as required§          §          §THE PERSON:§          §The successful candidate will have excellent interpersonal skills. You are good at organising and planning and you anticipate requirements. You will have a ‘big picture’ view of organisational needs and also have excellent attention to detail. The candidate that we are looking for will be highly professional and understand the importance of maintaining confidentiality.§          §The ideal candidate will:§          §            §Be a team player who enjoys being supportive to achieve organisational goals§            §Have some interest in the insurance brokerage field and have the required financial acumen§            §Have well developed verbal and written communication skills§            §Have suitable qualifications and/or relevant experience§            §Have demonstrated initiative and common sense§            §Be great at customer service§          §          §HOURS OF WORK:§          §This is a Monday to Friday role, the usual hours of work will be 8.30am-5.00pm with 30 minutes for lunch.§          §HOW TO APPLY:§          §If you think you’re the person we’re searching for, let us know! jobTitle: Claims Settlement Consultant Job in Manawatu - SEEK
experience: Since 1905 FMG has been protecting the interests of rural New Zealand. Now over 100 years
jobText: TXT/50704071.txt	§Claims Settlement Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Settlement Consultant§§Advertiser: §FMG§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§We are looking for a Claims Settlement Consultant on a 6 month fixed term to join our Claims team.§As part of our Palmerston North based Claim team, this role is accountable for ensuring all processing of our claims payments to external parties and clients, within a settlement category, are within agreed best practice and FMG’s service standards.§Since 1905 FMG has been protecting the interests of rural New Zealand. Now over 100 years later, we’re still 100% New Zealand owned and the country’s leading rural insurance specialist. As a mutual we invest profits back into the business to keep our premiums competitive for clients. As an employer, we invest in our people to foster a working environment that promotes achievement and celebrates success!§ §This role will provide effective management of all settlement processes, including but not limited to, bulk invoicing, supplier invoice payments, direct payments to clients and process/system improvements.§The ability to work supportively and collaboratively as part of the wider Claims Team to assist in implementing and leading our vision as well as to continually identify ways to improve the claims service provided to FMG’s clients will be key!§The ideal candidate for this role will have an eye for detail, be organised and a desire to identify and enable process improvements and continued efficiencies in this function.§So go on, make it happen - apply now! Applications close 5pm, Thursday 22nd October 2020.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Claims-Settlement-Consultant-PD-2020.doc§§§§

jobText: TXT/50709186.txt	§Insurance Broker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Broker§§Advertiser: §BrokerWeb Risk Services Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Take over a solid mixed book of SME and commercial accounts. Want to work from home? Flexible working is encouraged! §  §BWRS prides itself on being an expert in insurance and risk. We focus on how we best meet the clients’ needs and we deliver quality, relevant service and give our clients’ choice using the entire market. Small enough to be agile and decisive in an ever-changing environment, but large enough to have National and International reach - we compete against large global players and win! §  §With a strong focus on growth and performance, this role will come with an existing book of SME and commercial clients. You will be responsible to continue to provide BWRS’s excellent service and advice while looking for growth opportunities within the book and new clients to the business.  You will be passionate about delivering the best for clients.§  §In addition, you will be responsible for:§ § §Building and servicing the needs of a portfolio of clients in line with BWRS client commitment, service levels and procedures, ensuring all possible is done to retain those clients§ §Providing a professional and transparent service to all clients in accordance with service standards§ §Timely and thorough client renewals § §Guiding, training and assisting your assistant broker § §Exploring new business opportunities§ §Liaising with Insurers on insurance matters§ §Remarketing policies at renewal time§ §Processing renewals, endorsements, cancellations and finance agreements§ §Credit control§ § §  §To be successful in this role, you will have:§ § §Proven technical expertise in a wide range of insurable risks§ §Excellent working knowledge of the insurance industry with experience in a client facing role§ §Excellent negotiation skills§ §The ability to form new and retain relationships with all stakeholders§ §A passion for your own learning as well as developing others § §Exceptional communication skills; both written and oral and be highly competent in MS Office products§ §Ability to adapt quickly to new IT environments § §A track record of delivering solutions on complex matters § § §  §Culture §  §With a recent change to the Senior Executive Team, we are a company driving the development of our people. We have a values based Executive that works cohesively to build and maintain momentum to support our focus on growth. §  §We are a people and client-centric business growing fast and looking to add talented people to our business. It is important to BWRS to build a workplace that encourages diversity and inclusion, allowing us to better reflect the broad client base we work with. We encourage all our people to look at how flexible working can work for them and we have committed to paying everyone a minimum of The Living Wage. We understand that it is our people that deliver clients the service they value, and that is why we are focused on creating an amazing place to work.§  §Apply Now§  §If you are looking for a new challenge and a role to truly make your own, apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.§  §BWRS is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that is committed to its people and their potential.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§
