jobTitle: Recovery Coordinator - New Plymouth Job in Taranaki - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50709310.txt	§Recovery Coordinator - New Plymouth§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recovery Coordinator - New Plymouth§§Advertiser: §ACC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Client conversations and assessment of client medical/health requirements to provide positive solutions and outcomes§Partner with health providers to bring the right services to clients in a timely way§Opportunity to grow and learn in a fast-paced but positive environment§As a Recovery Coordinator, the role is very much about working with our clients and being responsible to ensuring our clients have a planned road to recovery. This is about having meaningful conversations with clients to discuss and understand their injury, and the impact it has on their daily life. Working together, and ensuring all the right information is available, you will tailor a rehabilitation program to suit their needs.§ACC has been improving the lives of New Zealanders since 1974. With ACC, you'll be supporting people in Aotearoa to stay safe by minimising the incidence and impact of injury, as well as helping them recover from injury if an accident does happen. Join us - an organisation that grew out of bold thinking and has an enduring commitment to care for others at work, home and play.§You will support clients by understanding their injury and coming up with solutions to a positive return to work/life. Working closely with medical practitioners, client employers and suppliers you could engage via phone, email or in person. Your health knowledge - technical, terminology and solutions - across clinical and recovery practices will support the provision of our client's recovery. You will assess client needs and continue to provide support and guide their recovery for as long as the client needs.§What we are looking for from you to be successful in this role:§Strong communication skills are important - written and oral, in an engaging and supportive style§Ability to interpret, apply and explain complex legislation§Great time management skills and ability to organise your day well§Empathy - some client situations are complex so demonstrating strong emotional intelligence§Personal resilience as you will be working with people experiencing challenging circumstances§Previous experience working in a social services, disability or health environment is advantageous§Working at ACC§We know that a diverse and inclusive team helps us meet the needs of our customers, and we welcome applications from people of every ethnicity, national origin, gender orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, and/or status as an individual with a disability. It's important to us that people bring their whole selves to work.§To support an inclusive workplace we have the following:§Employee networks:§- Pride@ACC§- Ability@ACC§- Women's Network§- Cross-Cultural Network§ACC's Māori Strategy, Whāia te Tika§Development opportunities in te reo Māori me ngā tikanga§Advocates in the disability sector§Diversity and Inclusion Approach§Support Māori by partnering with iwi and other Māori entities§We offer an indicative salary of $57,000 plus ACC's 9% superannuation contribution. Ongoing learning and development will be provided so this provides an excellent opportunity to grow and develop.§Click here to view the role description§§Applications will run through to Sunday, 18 October 2020 §but please note that if an ideal candidate is found during this time we may move forward with our pre-screening process.§Please note Interviews will be held on 22 October 2020.§Applications will only be accepted when submitted through our career website§. If you encounter accessibility issues when submitting your application, or if you have any questions about the role please email §vicki.jeffries@acc.co.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50718255.txt	§Broker Support - Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Broker Support - Administrator§§Advertiser: §Thames Valley Insurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Thames & Coromandel§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§About the business:§  §Thames Valley Insurance Brokers is a small, well established, Thames based business and is a member of the NZbrokers group. We provide fire & general insurance broking services to a varied client base across NZ.§  §About the role:§ §  §Your role will have variety and is pivotal in the efficient operation of this business, with a strong focus on customer service and meeting the insurance needs of our domestic clients.        §  §Key duties:§ § §General office administration and responding to customer enquiries§ §Processing new business, renewals and endorsements§ §Liaising with insurers and clients§ §Support to brokers§ §Key attributes we are looking for:§ § §​Insurance experience is essential§ §excellent communication skills - both written and verbal§ §ability to work under pressure§ §Excellent computer skills - competent in Microsoft office products​ and knowledge of eGlobal system would be ideal§ §High attention to detail§ §Manage ​own workload and time effectively§ §Ability and willingness to learn on the job§ §Permanent residency status is essential§ §Full time preferred, yet flexibility would be considered for the right candidate.§  §If you're interested in joining our small dynamic team plus relish the opportunity to work and play in the beautiful Thames - Coromandel district, we'd like to hear from you. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50721100.txt	§Customer Service & Underwriting Specialist§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service & Underwriting Specialist§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§Customer Service & Underwriting Consultant Penrose Auckland § §About this role. § §Petplan is looking for a Customer Service Specialist & Underwriting specialist to join our vibrant  Pet insurance team you will work with a team of motivated people to deliver excellent service and great outcomes. You will be expected to:§ § §Handle queries from existing customers and partners regarding their Insurance policies§ §Effectively handle and action any customer complaints§ §Provide excellent customer service by identifying and resolving any quoting, processing or underwriting issues§ §Proactively assessing customer needs and finding the best insurance solution for them.§ §Being a supportive, collaborative and actively involved team player§ §Looking to contribute ideas and initiatives to continually improve our customer experience§ § § §About You § § §Experience within the financial services industry - highly regarded§ §Previous corporate experience, particularly focused on customer service or sales§ §An engaging personality with a passion for interacting with customers and partners§ §A drive to deliver an exceptional customer experience in every interaction§ §The self-motivation to achieve goals and objectives.§ §Effective communication, questioning and listening skills§ §A great work ethic with a positive attitude and outlook§ § § §What you’ll get in return§ §This is a fantastic opportunity to make a difference and grow in your finance career  § §Supportive team environment§ §Bring your Pet to Work§ §If you feel that you have the skills for this role please send your cover letter and resume to §sharonbuffone@petplan.com.au§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Account Broker - Wairoa Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50721275.txt	§Account Broker - Wairoa§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Broker - Wairoa§§Advertiser: §Aon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Rare opportunity to work in a niche area with an iconic global brand§ §Become part of a close-knit team§ §Develop your skills working with high net worth clients§ §The Opportunity§ § §Due to an internal promotion we have a rare opportunity to join the Wairoa branch as a Claims Broker.§ § §This role will see you assisting with day to day administration and provide claims support for the team. To succeed in this role you will need to be able confidently communicate with stakeholders both internal and external, have excellent attention to detail and the ability to prioritise and juggle multiple activities.§ § §Furthermore you will be responsible for:§ §Claims administration service for professional indemnity and other liability claims as assigned for group schemes and individual clients of the Professional Risks Division§ §Liaison with Clients  Insurers, Co-Insurers and any appointed legal advisers as per the relevant protocols.§ §Internal claims processing§ §Perform other duties within the normal business activities of the company as may be required to from time to time§ §This is a rare opportunity for an Insurance professional to continue develop their capabilities in a diverse and challenging role.§ § §About you§ § §To be successful in this role you will need to have previous claims background or have worked within insurance. Specifically, we will be looking for a high standard of presentation and an ability to engage and specialise within the claims space for our professional risk clients.  § § §To be successful in this role you will display:§ § §Demonstrated capacity for working in a similar role /support role within the financial services / insurance sector is preferred.§ §Confident communication skills verbally and written.§ §Strong listening skills and to be able to demonstrate empathy§ §Competency with Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook.§ §The ability to deliver high standards of quality customer service.§ §Calmness under pressure and be someone who can go the extra mile.§ §Friendly and positive attitude.§ §Must be a team player§ §Your willingness to turn your hand to anything and initiative are key. You will be part of a small team where there is ongoing development and support to encourage you to perform at your best.§ § §Aon Culture & Benefits§ § §This role will have an attractive base salary, superannuation, annual discretionary bonus, and our Aon Benefits. Please refer to our careers pages for further benefits Aon offer to all permanent employees.§ § §Apply now and become part of our specialities division! § §You must be currently in NZ and have working eligibility to accept permanent work. § § §Aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50728552.txt	§Senior Broker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Broker§§Advertiser: §BrokerWeb Risk Services Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§BWRS prides itself on being an expert in insurance and risk. We focus on how we best meet the clients’ needs and we deliver quality, relevant service and give our clients’ choice using the entire market. Small enough to be agile and decisive in an ever-changing environment, but large enough to have National and International reach - we compete against large global players and win! §With a strong focus on growth and performance, this role is a replacement for an internal move and will come with an existing book of large commercial clients. You will be responsible to continue to provide BWRS’s excellent service and advice while looking for growth opportunities within the book and new clients to the business.  You will be passionate about delivering the best for clients.§ §In addition, you will be responsible for:§Building and servicing the needs of a portfolio of clients in line with BWRS client commitment, service levels and procedures, ensuring all possible is done to retain those clients§providing a professional and transparent service to all clients in accordance with service standards§timely and thorough client renewals §guiding, training and assisting your assistant broker and other members of the wider team § §To be successful in this role, you will have:§Proven technical expertise in a wide range of commercial insurable risks§Excellent working knowledge of the insurance industry with experience at a senior level §Excellent negotiation skills§The ability to form new and retain relationships with all stakeholders§A natural leadership style and ability to influence across role levels and geographies §A passion for your own learning as well as developing others §Exceptional communication skills; both written and oral and be highly competent in MS Office products§Ability to adapt quickly to new IT environments §A track record of delivering solutions on complex matters § §Culture §With a recent change to the Senior Executive Team, we are a company driving the development of our people. We have a values based Executive that works cohesively to build and maintain momentum to support our focus on growth. §We are a people and client-centric business growing fast and looking to add talented people to our business. It is important to BWRS to build a workplace that encourages diversity and inclusion, allowing us to better reflect the broad client base we work with. We encourage all our people to look at how flexible working can work for them and we have committed to paying everyone a minimum of The Living Wage. We understand that it is our people that deliver clients the service they value, and that is why we are focused on creating an amazing place to work.§ §Apply Now§If you are looking for a new challenge and a role to truly make your own, apply online today with a brief covering letter and your resume, sharing relevant achievements for this position.§BWRS is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that is committed to its people and their potential.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50745950.txt	§Insurance Business Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Business Development Manager§§Advertiser: §Ando§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Underwriting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Insurance Business Development Manager §      §        §Business Development Manager - Waikato§        §At Ando, we’re taking a fresh approach to the way insurance works in New Zealand.§        §During the four years we’ve been operating, we have achieved strong growth in the New Zealand insurance market and have continued to focus on using new technology to deliver vastly improved customer experiences.§        §To continue our growth, we’re looking for a highly motivated and experienced Business Development Manager to join our hard-working Commercial Markets team. This role is a remote role covering the Waikato region, with regular travel to our Auckland and Tauranga offices. Supporting the Regional Manager, you will be ready to take the leap into this great team, making a valuable contribution to the business strategy.§        §Your key accountabilities will include:§        §          §Managing and growing a portfolio of clients across a variety of Commercial Lines products including Property, Liability and Motor;§          §Generating new business and maximizing premium and renewal retention, whilst maintaining strong underwriting principals;§          §Broker training and presentations;§          §Building strong client relationships in order to grow the Ando business.§        §        §You show the following qualities:§        §          §A strong team player, keen to develop strong networks internally and externally;§          §Solid experience across multiple commercial lines of business including Property, Liability and Motor;§          §Proven track record in growing a portfolio of business within the NZ insurance market with the ability to balance risk and commerciality in underwriting decisions;§          §Great sales discipline, with the ability to set and achieve growth targets;§          §Excellent communication skills with a strong client focus;§          §The flexibility to adapt and evolve with the business;§          §Ability to travel when necessary.§        §        §Ideally you will have 8 years of general insurance experience. You will be a team player, ready and willing to live and breathe the Ando culture - our people and customers are at the heart of everything we do at Ando. The environment is fast-paced and ever changing, with great opportunities lying ahead for the right candidate. Are you up for the challenge?§        §If this sounds like a perfect role for you, please click Apply Now attaching a Cover Letter and CV.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Business Development Manager - Waikato§  §At Ando, we’re taking a fresh approach to the way insurance works in New Zealand.§  §During the four years we’ve been operating, we have achieved strong growth in the New Zealand insurance market and have continued to focus on using new technology to deliver vastly improved customer experiences.§  §To continue our growth, we’re looking for a highly motivated and experienced Business Development Manager to join our hard-working Commercial Markets team. This role is a remote role covering the Waikato region, with regular travel to our Auckland and Tauranga offices. Supporting the Regional Manager, you will be ready to take the leap into this great team, making a valuable contribution to the business strategy.§  §Your key accountabilities will include:§ § §Managing and growing a portfolio of clients across a variety of Commercial Lines products including Property, Liability and Motor;§ §Generating new business and maximizing premium and renewal retention, whilst maintaining strong underwriting principals;§ §Broker training and presentations;§ §Building strong client relationships in order to grow the Ando business.§ §You show the following qualities:§ § §A strong team player, keen to develop strong networks internally and externally;§ §Solid experience across multiple commercial lines of business including Property, Liability and Motor;§ §Proven track record in growing a portfolio of business within the NZ insurance market with the ability to balance risk and commerciality in underwriting decisions;§ §Great sales discipline, with the ability to set and achieve growth targets;§ §Excellent communication skills with a strong client focus;§ §The flexibility to adapt and evolve with the business;§ §Ability to travel when necessary.§ §Ideally you will have 8 years of general insurance experience. You will be a team player, ready and willing to live and breathe the Ando culture - our people and customers are at the heart of everything we do at Ando. jobText: TXT/50736127.txt	§Account Broker/Claims Advocate§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Broker/Claims Advocate§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Account Broker/Claims Advocate§Insure Taranaki is a fire and general broking firm based in New Plymouth, Taranaki. We provide our clients with independent, personal, professional and simple risk management and general insurance advice. As a member broker of Insurance Advisernet, we provide our clients with Local Understanding, National Strength with a personal touch. Insure Taranaki has been steadily growing its business since it was established in 2016 and is now on the hunt for the right person to further support the business and our clients. §The Role§An exciting career opportunity for an experienced Account Broker/Claims Advocate to join the Insure Taranaki team. The successful candidate will combine their upbeat personality, fastidious nature and empathy with an agile and professional demeanour to offer exceptional service to our clients. Reporting directly to the Director this role will be responsible for end to end insurance portfolio management for our clients with a key focus on ensuring superior claims process and outcomes. §The day to day key tasks of this role are the following: §Personal lines/small business broking§. You will be responsible for reviewing renewal offers for our personal lines and small business clients and managing the client renewal process. Full support will be provided by the company director. §Initial review/calculations and preparation§ of larger business insurance renewal offers. Providing the opportunity to be exposed to more complex business accounts and upskill your knowledge.§Client claim management/advocacy§. We pride ourselves on superior claims advocacy for our clients. You will be responsible for keeping an up to date track and file of all current claims. Liaising with insurers, repairers and our clients. Putting in place processes and reminders will be a key to success in this task. A problem solving and solution driven mindset will see you thrive. Full support will be available to you by the company director whenever needed. §General insurance administration and processing.§ Working within our leading remote accessed ibroker software you will be able to complete a wide range of transactional insurance processing for our client’s renewals and programme amendments. A high level of attention to detail is a must. §Our Ideal Candidate §The ideal successful candidate with have the following key attributes: §Bachelor's Degree in Commerce or similar field is desirable. §Equivalent work experience will be considered.§Minimum two years experience in similar or other relevant roles. §Confidence to be autonomous and manage own workload. §Process driven with a keen eye for detail. §Positive client outcome focus with strong communication skills over the phone with clients, insurers and repairers/contractors is essential. §Suits a solution driven individual who has the ability to negotiate and problem solve. Contractual interpretation skills will be beneficial. §What to expect from us§We look forward to welcoming the successful candidate to our intimate and social team within a truly unique insurance business environment! In return for your skills, we offer you the opportunity to join a growing, locally run business and be part of a team that values interpersonal relationships and its clients, promotes teamwork and collaboration and embraces innovation. We recognise and reward excellence, forward thinking and loyalty. Our goal is to offer a workplace that you feel valued and offers talented individuals the opportunity to thrive. As such, we provide competitive salaries and welcome the opportunity for a team member who is looking to grow along with the business. Whilst this is a full-time position (Mon-Fri) this is open to discussion for the right candidate. §If you have the skills, spark and drive to help us on our journey please hit Apply Now. We believe that cover letters are important to help us better understand why you are interested in this position, please take this into consideration when submitting your application. §Note: we will endeavor to get in contact with all applicants in regards to the outcome of your application.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the insurance industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50736797.txt	§Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Manager§§Advertiser: §Aon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Responsibilities§ §Build a stable career with a global Insurance leader§ §Competitive package and benefits § §Be part of a high performing region!§ § § §The Opportunity§ § § §Aon’s Blenheim branch currently has an opportunity for a proven relationship builder to support and grow an established client base. The Blenheim branch is one of our 80 branches throughout our Aon network. The Branch supports a mixture of commercial, domestic and rural clients.§ § § §In this position you will work with a book of existing clients. A part of your role will focus on building relationships and driving new business. You will have a broker support who will provide support to you on a daily basis from an administration perspective.§ § § §Day-to-day you might work on:§ §Client visits and relationship building§ §Managing annual client renewals  § §Liaising with Insurers and Underwriters§ § §About You§ § § §Ideally you would come from an Insurance Broking background and the expectations of the role can be tailored to your level of experience. You could step into the role as an experienced Account Manager or develop into it as a trainee broker. § § § §We will be looking for:§ §Proven background building client relationships§ §Autonomy and confidence managing your own portfolio§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §Experience growing new business would be advantageous § § You will need to be a confident and resilient person who genuinely believes in the Aon brand and the benefits it can offer. The Branch has a supportive and fun culture that ensures a great work-life balance so you can enjoy the best of the beautiful Marlborough region.      § § § §Aon Culture & Benefits§ § § §At Aon, we provide colleagues with the support to make a positive impact together with ongoing opportunities for development, including the support of a team which will continually inspire you to achieve the best.§ § § §We currently have approximately 850 employees in New Zealand. Globally, we have an employee base of 50,000 people, working across 120 countries. This allows us to build the best teams and gather the best thinking from around the world to deliver quality solutions and service locally.§ § § §Aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.§ § § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50742700.txt	§Underwriting Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Underwriting Technician§§Advertiser: §Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Other§§§§§§About the business§ § § §A strategic and trusted insurance partner, Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI), provides a broad range of commercial property, casualty and specialty insurance coverages and outstanding service to customers and brokers around the world. Part of Berkshire Hathaway's insurance operations, we bring our solutions to market with our stellar brand name, top-rated balance sheet, and the expertise of our global team of professionals, who exude excellent capabilities and strong character.§ §We are a values-based organization where respect, integrity, excellence, collaboration, and passion define who we are and how we do business.  We value diversity of backgrounds, experience, and perspectives and strive to foster an inclusive environment that enables all our team members to bring their best selves to work.  We are one team committed to building a culture where every teammate has the opportunity to contribute and be recognized. Want to be part of the team building the finest property, casualty and specialty lines insurance company in the world?§ §Visit our website at www.bhspecialty.com§ § § §About the role§ § § §In this role you will perform tasks to directly support the underwriting process including pre-quote, pre-bind, bind and post bind transactions. The UT will also perform underwriting support activities associated with information gathering and rating for new business, renewals and midterm changes and assist with electronic file preparation on behalf of the Underwriter.  Additionally, there is the opportunity to contribute to the broader team on a wide range of projects.  You will learn the insurance business, gaining experience and exposure to different aspects of commercial insurance and then have the opportunity to progress into one of a number of career streams - underwriting, claims or operations.§ §Duties & Responsibilities:§ §• Support underwriters with all activities related to account development§• Build files and ensure file integrity§• Coordinate policy issuance and liaise with Operations team§• Triage broker submissions and ensure all required underwriting data is accurate§• Draft quotes and binders and review with underwriters§• Correspond with brokers; follow up on outstanding information§• Act as a liaison to the Operations teams both locally and globally.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Our culture is liberating and fast paced and how that plays out is a purposefully non-bureaucratic organisation which is centred on doing what is right for our customers, colleagues and our business.  The role will offer a competitive package in addition to growth and development.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §We are seeking commercially astute graduates interested in developing their career in the insurance sector. This is an entry level role supporting the Underwriting team. You will learn the insurance business, gaining experience and exposure to different aspects of commercial insurance and then have the opportunity to progress into one of a number of career streams - underwriting, claims or operations§ §You must be able to demonstrate an interest in the commercial insurance sector and be willing to commit to developing your knowledge and skills, both through on-the-job training and further studies§ § §Appropriate qualifications completed or in process, e.g. tertiary qualifications or industry certification. Must be willing to undertake further relevant studies e.g. ANZIIF certification§ §Analytical, and inquiring. Able to use your initiative§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Customer focus. Able to develop and manage relationships with our customers and business partners and with internal colleagues to ensure the right outcome for the customer§Thorough and with good attention to detail§Strong competency in MS Office applications§A demonstrated interest in a career in insurance would be highly regarded§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50728190.txt	§Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Manager§§Advertiser: §Aon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Brokerage§§§§§§Responsibilities§ §Account Manager | Gisborne § § § §Build a progressive career with a global Insurance leader § §Opportunity to expand an established book of clients § §Join a high-performing team with a great working culture § §  § §The Opportunity§ § § §This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Account Manager to join our Gisborne branch and continue their successful growth track record. Our Gisborne branch is one of our 80 branches throughout our Aon network, supporting a mixture of commercial, domestic and rural clients.§ §  § §In this position you will work with a book of well-established clients in the region. A large part of your role will focus on building strong client relationships to better support their risk mitigation needs and driving new business.§ § § §This role will have an attractive base salary, vehicle, superannuation, annual discretionary bonus, and unique benefits Aon offer. Please refer to our careers pages for further benefits we offer to all permanent employees.§ § § § § §To be successful in this role, you should have:§ § § §A proven sales record, preferably within the Insurance sector§ §A consultative approach to client support and business development§ §The ability to build positive working relationships with clients and colleagues§ §A self-starter attitude with a drive for meeting/ exceeding targets § §An analytical mindset and attention-to-detail for the technical aspects of the role§ §  § §Aon Benefits & Culture§ §  § §At Aon, we provide colleagues with the support to make a positive impact together with ongoing opportunities for development, including the support of a team which will continually inspire you to achieve the best.§ §  § §We currently have approximately 900 employees in New Zealand. Globally, we have an employee base of 50,000 people, working across 120 countries. This allows us to build the best teams and gather the best thinking from around the world to deliver quality solutions and service locally.§ § § § § §About Aon§ §Aon Risk Solutions is a multi-faceted retail broking and risk management service that specialises in providing products, services, and solutions to meet the diverse and varied needs of our clients. We help our clients anticipate the obstacles that stand in the way of achieving their business vision by providing innovative, effective solutions that help clear the path to their success. Our clients range from multi-national companies to individuals who use our expertise to manage their own personal financial risks.§ § § §  § §Aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50747205.txt	§Claims Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Advisor§§Advertiser: §Zurich Financial Services Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Claims Advisor §      §Claims Advisor – Financial Lines § §        §Are you an experienced Claims Advisor or Solicitor with a passion for delivering results? Do you thrive in an environment where your skills and expertise gains respect from your colleagues? If so, then this opportunity may be for you. § §        §The overall objective of the role is to ensure that claims are handled in the most efficient, effective way while delivering a customer-centric claims service. Reporting to the Financial Lines Claims Manager, the role will see you providing market leading, timely, effective and cost efficient management of a portfolio of Financial Lines Claims including claims relating to directors & officers, crime, cyber, management liability, employment practices liability, and professional indemnity.§        §        §You will be required to manage claims, evaluate claims and defence costs reserves based on your analysis of liability and quantum. You will be working closely with underwriters, brokers and insured's to pursue the best possible resolution strategy. You would also be responsible for forging strong relationships with a number of stakeholders both within and outside of Zurich, therefore will possess superior communications skills, both written and verbal. §        §        §To be successful in this role you will have sound insurance knowledge and experience; knowledge relevant legislation and regulations governing General Insurance practices. Additionally, you will possess 2+ years legal experience, preferably in civil law litigation (particularly Directors & Officers/PI) and/or 3+ years financial lines/specialty insurance experience such as directors & officers, professional indemnity, employment practices, cyber, management liability, and crime insurance.§ §        §As a long-standing player in the insurance industry, we make every effort to address the career development needs and plans of our employees to ensure their success in the future.§ §        §So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported. Love what you do. Work for us. Apply Today!§        § §      §      §        §        § Please click the 'Apply for this job' button below to submit your application§      §    §    §www.zurich.com.au§  §§§Claims Advisor – Financial Lines § §Are you an experienced Claims Advisor or Solicitor with a passion for delivering results? Do you thrive in an environment where your skills and expertise gains respect from your colleagues? If so, then this opportunity may be for you. § §The overall objective of the role is to ensure that claims are handled in the most efficient, effective way while delivering a customer-centric claims service. Reporting to the Financial Lines Claims Manager, the role will see you providing market leading, timely, effective and cost efficient management of a portfolio of Financial Lines Claims including claims relating to directors & officers, crime, cyber, management liability, employment practices liability, and professional indemnity.§§You will be required to manage claims, evaluate claims and defence costs reserves based on your analysis of liability and quantum. You will be working closely with underwriters, brokers and insured's to pursue the best possible resolution strategy. You would also be responsible for forging strong relationships with a number of stakeholders both within and outside of Zurich, therefore will possess superior communications skills, both written and verbal. §§To be successful in this role you will have sound insurance knowledge and experience; knowledge relevant legislation and regulations governing General Insurance practices. Additionally, you will possess 2+ years legal experience, preferably in civil law litigation (particularly Directors & Officers/PI) and/or 3+ years financial lines/specialty insurance experience such as directors & officers, professional indemnity, employment practices, cyber, management liability, and crime insurance.§ §As a long-standing player in the insurance industry, we make every effort to address the career development needs and plans of our employees to ensure their success in the future.§ §So make a difference. Be challenged. Be inspired. Be supported. Love what you do. Work for us. Apply Today!§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50722377.txt	§Claims Administrator - Personal Injury§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Administrator - Personal Injury§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§Work at one of NZs top 15 best insurance employers§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§ §Managing International Insurers and Providers.  Work for a global organisation that is recognised in the Top 15 Best NZ Employers in Insurance! § §6 month fixed term, full time role § § §Excellent opportunity to cement your claims career or take the next step § § §Work collaboratively with a dynamic, busy and friendly team § §Gallagher Bassett (GB) is New Zealand's premier third party administrator. We manage group insurance plans and claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured organisations. We are part of the leading global risk management and insurance group Arthur J Gallagher & Co, with over 29,000 great people worldwide in over 140 countries.§ § §Through a team geographically dispersed throughout New Zealand, GB provides a suite of claims management and related services out of offices located in Auckland, Christchurch, and Dunedin.§ § §We are proud to be one of 124 companies, from 19 countries and representing 52 industry categories, named on the Ethisphere Institute’s 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies list for the ninth consecutive year.§ § §The position§   §We are currently looking for a highly-motivated individual who will bring passion, enthusiasm and commitment to this fast-paced role.  As first point of call, you will be responsible for providing essential administrative responsibilities and information gathering to ensure the smooth and accurate processing of personal injury claims.  To be successful in this role you will have an excellent telephone manner, high-quality listening skills and attention to detail. § § Your key responsibilities will include: § §Lodging new claims for assessment and record details throughout the process including information gathering, treatment requests and obtaining incident reports § § § §Gathering and following up on information in order to assist in determining cover, including making cover decisions for low risk claims§ § § §Accurate interpretation of ACC legislation pertaining to Claims Management§ § § §Managing incoming calls that come through from our customers and, where possible, dealing with inquiries, or directing the call to the appropriate person § § § §Generating and sending appropriate correspondence to follow up on claims and sending referrals to specialists § § § §Keep updated records and provide these to key stakeholders in a timely manner§ § § § § §The person§  §We want you to be successful, therefore as a minimum you’ll need:§ § §Ideally at least 12 months’ insurance industry or ACC experience § § § §You will be familiar with process improvement and have a strong background in customer service§ § § §Fantastic communication skills, allowing you to build an easy rapport with customers and your colleagues§ § § §Great time management where you can demonstrate you can juggle multiple priorities with ease§ § §Be computer and systems savvy§ §Positive and hard-working attitude § §The benefits§ § § Life at GB is often fast paced, unpredictable, challenging, yet also deeply rewarding. It is social and engaging, with some of our benefits including: § §Attractive remuneration package§ §Flexible working§ §Staff referral incentive§ §Service recognition awards§ §Employee Wellness Program§ § §Employee Assistance Program (for yourself and immediate family members); and§ § § §The opportunity to work for a company that gives back to the community through our Gentle Bear program § § §To apply§   §If you think you can make a positive difference to our business we want to hear from you today!§ Click on Apply for this Job.  §   §Only people with the right to work in this country will be considered for this position.§ § §Previous applicants need not re-apply, as previous applications have been retained.§ § §Applications from agencies will not be accepted§.§ § § § § § § § § §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50746021.txt	§Senior Claims Assessor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Claims Assessor§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§§§§  §    §Senior Claims Assessor §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35247§        §About the Historic Claims team§        §The Ministry of Social Development (MSD) provides an Alternative Disputes Resolution Service (ADRS) to assist claimants address concerns and abuse whilst in State care. §        §The ADRS is underpinned by the principles of Tikanga Māori, Mana, Aroha, Whakapapa, Whānaungatanga, Manaakitanga and Pono.§        §The team is currently made up of highly culturally responsive people who are specialists in assessing claims.§        §About this role§ §        §You will collate information about a claimant’s time in care by assessing and providing a recommendation to complete their claim. This role is pivotal to helping claimants.§        §What you will need to succeed:§        §          §Ability to review and interpret large amounts of complex and sensitive information to make informed decisions.§          §Superb writing skills.§          §Solution focused with strong problem-solving abilities.§          §Strong attention to detail and positive attitude.§          §Flexible and resilient with the ability to cope under pressure.§          §Working collaboratively towards building a great claimant experience.§          §Able to work in a team that is committed to upholding the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi, the development of a service that is culturally responsive and incorporates Tikanga Māori.§        §        §In addition, the Senior Claims Assessor will:§        §          §Complete the more complex claims assessments.§          §Provide peer review for assessments.§          §Provide support, mentoring and guidance to Claims Assessors.§        §        §Relevant tertiary qualification or equal experience is desirable for those interested in a senior role.§        §If this sounds like you, have a look at our position description and consider applying!§        §If you would like to know more about this role, please send us an email to: §historic_claims_recruitment@msd.govt.nz§        §How to Apply§        §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV, cover letter and complete the online application form. jobText: TXT/50753973.txt	§Insurance Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Manager§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$118,940-$146,925 including 4% super contribution§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §Insurance Manager §    §      §        §What you will do§As the Insurance Manager, you will be the centralised point for developing and implementing insurance policies that are strategically relevant and economically appropriate. This is to ensure appropriate protection is in place for all of the NZ Defence Force’s material assets.§You will also be responsible for:§        §          §Directing and monitoring the programme of work associated with the annual insurance renewal programme;§          §Providing in-house leadership and subject matter expertise about insurance related matters;§          §Working in partnership with the external insurance broker and Financial Controller to ensure cost effective solutions;§          §Leading, guiding and motivating the Insurance Advisor at a strategic and operational level; and§          §Managing, updating and improving policies and process to ensure they are designed to protect NZDF’s assets.§        §        §Please note: §You will be required to travel domestically to visit NZ Defence Force sites.§What we need§This unique role requires a highly motivated, self-starter with extensive insurance experience within a large, complex business environment.  You will be able to build professional relationships based on trust and integrity; you will lead from the front to consistently deliver exceptional service and quality outcomes along with encouraging and empowering others to do the same.§You must also have:§        §          §10 years’ experience working within Insurance and Asset Protection;§          §Relevant experience applying risk management tools to protect an organisation’s asset base;§          §Excellent communication, relationship building and influencing skills to proactively engage with internal and external stakeholders; and§          §Experience working at a strategic level with an ability to make decisions with a long-term, forward thinking approach.§        §        §Who we are§The purpose of NZDF Finance is to assist the Government and NZDF utilise resources to deliver an optimised military effect through the provision of strategic financial management services enabling integrated capability decisions. NZDF Finance indirectly supports the Output Plan by providing financial services and support to meet key decision making requirements or through the provision of specialist financial support to our business customers. Members of NZDF Finance will also contribute thoughts, ideas and observations from a multi-disciplined perspective to all levels of the NZDF to help with the formation and implementation of strategy.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§        §          §Great benefits for you and your family§; §          §Discounts Handbook for selected retail, entertainment and service providers;§          §5 weeks annual leave per year;§          §Variety, challenge and a chance to influence.§        §        §How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page. For further information, contact Simon Gibbs on 021 907 160.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Wednesday 28 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§        §          §most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§          §is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§        §        §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§What you will do§As the Insurance Manager, you will be the centralised point for developing and implementing insurance policies that are strategically relevant and economically appropriate. jobText: TXT/50754402.txt	§Claims Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Team Leader§§Advertiser: §FMG§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§We have a challenging, exciting and very rare opportunity for an ambitious and driven individual to become a Claims Team Leader, a role that is vital to drive the success of our Claims team.§Since 1905, FMG has had its roots firmly planted in rural New Zealand, which is why you’ll find that we're different when it comes to insurance. Now over 100 years later, we’re still 100% New Zealand owned and the country’s leading rural insurance specialist. As a Mutual we invest profits back into the business to keep our premiums competitive and continue provide outstanding service for clients. As an employer, we invest in our people to foster a working environment that promotes achievement and celebrates success!§Reporting to the Claims Consultant Manager and based in Palmerston North, you will be working with a team of Specialists and Consultants to ensure a high quality and professional claims experience is achieved for all FMG clients.  The team this role will be leading, focuses on assessing, managing and settling our liability claims as well as our claims recovery function.  This is a great role that will provide you with a challenge while continuing to build on your existing skills and expertise.§To be successful in this role, you will have a strong background in people leader management and proven experience in managing and leading a successful and dynamic team. You will be responsible for monitoring performance and identifying process improvement opportunities. We are looking for a leader who can demonstrate a hands-on, ground level approach and someone with strong listening, verbal and written communication skills.§If you relish working hard but also having fun along the way, this opportunity is the one you have been looking for!§Apply now! Applications close 5pm, Sunday 1st November 2020.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Claims-Team-Leader-PD.doc§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

As a key point-of-contact in the branch, you will engage with a range of colleagues and clients through the day.§ § § §A normal day would see you:§ §Managing the insurance claims process for clients § §Assisting with client quotes and renewals § §Preparing policy schedules, client presentations, and reports § §Working with clients’ insurance providers, law firms, and external vendors § §Supporting ad-hoc branch duties alongside the wider team   § § §About you§ § § §You could have a background in Administration or Office Support with a passion for putting the customer first and going the extra mile. Prior experience in Insurance would be an advantage but not essential – training will be provided if you are eager to learn. § § § §To hit the ground running, you should have: § §The ability to work well in a small team and chip in when needed§ §Excellent time management skills § §Good verbal and written communication skills § §Experience supporting business clients in an office environment § §Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (e.g. Outlook, Excel, Word) § §This is a rare opportunity for an experienced Administrator to build a career within Insurance – if you would like to be part of a global brand with local roots, apply today! § § § § §Aon Culture & Benefits§ § § §At Aon, we provide colleagues with the support to make a positive impact together with ongoing opportunities for development, including the support of a team which will continually inspire you to achieve your best.§ § § §We currently have approximately 900 employees in New Zealand. jobText: TXT/50800710.txt	§Case Manager - Fixed Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager - Fixed Term§§Advertiser: §Gallagher Bassett§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§Work for a top 15 best employer in insurance - NZ!§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§ §Managing International Insurers and Providers.  Work for a global organisation that is recognised as one of the world’s most ethical companies! § §Full-time 12 month fixed term role in a values based organisation § § §Excellent opportunity to cement your claims career or take the next step § § §Work collaboratively with a dynamic, busy and friendly team § §Gallagher Bassett (GB) is New Zealand's premier third party administrator. We manage group insurance plans and claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured organisations.  We are part of the leading global risk management and insurance group Arthur J Gallagher & Co, and awarded one of the Top 15 Best Employers in the NZ Insurance Industry 2020.§ § §Through a team geographically dispersed throughout New Zealand, GB provides a suite of claims management, risk control and related services out of offices located in Auckland, Christchurch, and Dunedin.§ § §We are proud to be one of 124 companies, from 19 countries and representing 52 industry categories, named on the Ethisphere Institute’s 2020 World’s Most Ethical Companies list for the ninth consecutive year.§  §The position§  §We are currently looking for a highly-motivated individual who will bring passion, enthusiasm and commitment to this important claims management role.  As next level support, you will be responsible for providing essential information and assistance to ensure the smooth and accurate processing of personal injury claims.  To be successful in this role you will maintain excellent customer relationships, have high-quality communication skills and ‘second-to-none’ attention to detail. §   §Your key responsibilities will include: § § §Managing a portfolio of work and non-work related injury claims, providing information and assistance to injured employees and their employers § § § §Developing and maintaining professional relationships with injured employees, employers and providers§ § § §Making clinical assessments of injuries and determining the appropriate level of entitlements within the provisions of the Act§ § §Arranging case conferences and claims reviews § §Ensuring compliance with legislation § § § §The person§ § § § §We want you to be successful, therefore as a minimum you’ll need:§ § § §Ideally, at least 12 months’ insurance industry or ACC experience § § § §You will be familiar with process improvement and have a strong background in customer service§ § § §Fantastic communication skills, allowing you to build an easy rapport with customers and your colleagues§ § § §Great time management where you can demonstrate you can juggle multiple priorities with ease§ § §Be computer and systems savvy§ §Positive and hard-working attitude § §Benefits & Culture§ §  § §When you join the Gallagher Bassett team, you’ll be joining a culture of best practice, partnership, success and fun! Every member of our team is highly skilled, with a passion for claims management. We work collaboratively to deliver meaningful and relevant services to our clients, and to ensure a consistently high level of job satisfaction among our team members.§   §Life at Gallagher Bassett is often fast-paced, unpredictable and challenging and our work is deeply rewarding, social and engaging.§  § Some of our benefits include: §Attractive remuneration package§ §Ongoing professional development§ §Flexible working arrangements§ §Free health insurance § §Employee referral incentive§ §Service recognition awards§ §Employee Wellness Program§ §Employee Assistance Program (for yourself and immediate family members)  § §If you have an interest in contributing to the health outcomes of the New Zealand workforce – and you’re looking to step into a great career with a progressive company – we look forward to hearing from you.  §  §Apply now!§ § §Click on Apply for this Job.§  §Only people with the right to work in this country will be considered for this position.§   §Applications from agencies will not be accepted.§  §If this sounds like you – apply now! § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50803342.txt	§Recovery Assistant - Wellington (Fixed-term & Permanent)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recovery Assistant - Wellington (Fixed-term & Permanent)§§Advertiser: §ACC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Claims§§§§§§Bring your case management experience§Provide excellent customer service to our injured clients§Make a difference to our clients' lives as they work towards their recovery§Multiple permanent and one seven month fixed term opportunities available§ACC's vision is to create a unique partnership with every New Zealander, improving their quality of life by minimising the incidence and impact of injury. ACC is shifting the ways we work with our clients to deliver meaningful support and guidance to over two million people recovering from accident or injury each year.§As a Recovery Assistant, you will proactively engage with our clients and support them through their recovery, using your excellent customer service skills in a phone based environment. You will guide them to plan their rehabilitation, including any treatment and supports, and ensure they understand how we can help.§§You will be part of a team with shared responsibility for case management of a pool of customers. You will answer client queries and be allocated tasks to deliver the best next action for our clients. You will be working as a part of a supportive team who will help you learn and grow in this role.§What we are looking for:§§Experience in managing client emails and phone queries in a fast paced environment.§Great communications skills - relate to a variety of people and simplify complex information§Great time management, able to prioritise and multi-task§Make informed decisions after reviewing all information available§Ability to follow workflows and processes§Excellent computer and software knowledge§Case Management experience and knowledge of the health sector and rehabilitation will be advantageous§The indicative base salary sits at $57,938 and then additional to this we also provide ACC's 9% superannuation contribution. The hours are 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday between the hours of 8am to 6pm flexibility may be required.§ACC is proud to be a diverse, equal opportunity workplace. We believe our workforce should represent the communities that we serve so we welcome applications from people with lived experience of disability and diverse backgrounds. Please contact David Stock, by §david.stock@acc.co.nz§ if you have any questions or need assistance with your application. We recognise that diversity, inclusion and accessibility is important to our business. ACC's Māori Strategy Whāia Te Tika provides the foundation for delivering better outcomes in a kaupapa Māori, culturally appropriate and responsive way for current and future Māori and diverse employees. ACC holds itself to a philosophy of Tika enabling us to create an environment of involvement, respect and connection with the communities where we work - benefiting individual employees and all our clients across New Zealand.§Applications close on midnight §Sunday, 1 November 2020.§ Applications will only be accepted when formally submitted through our ACC career website. If you have any questions about the role, please contact §david.stock@acc.co.nz§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50792174.txt	§Actuarial Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Actuarial Analyst§§Advertiser: §Fidelity Life§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Insurance & Superannuation§, §Actuarial§§§§§§Fidelity Life is the largest Kiwi-owned and operated life insurer and the 2017, 2018 and 2019 ANZIIF New Zealand Life Insurance Company of the Year. These are exciting times for Fidelity Life as we transform our business for a successful and sustainable future, with our customers at the centre of everything we do.§ §Be our new Actuarial Analyst in our team! § This is a fantastic opportunity if you have a few years or more experience in Actuarial.  Come and work with our Senior Actuarial Team on pricing, product development, experience analysis and financial reporting.§ §ABOUT OUR ROLE§ Some of your key responsibilities will include:§ § §Working with our product team to create sustainable pricing and products.§ §Creation and analysing information to assess the experience of our policies  § §Supporting the valuation function including creation of regulatory returns§ § §ABOUT YOU§ §For this role, you will need the following skills and experience:§ § §Undergraduate Degree in Actuarial studies, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related disciplines.§ §Excellent Microsoft Excel skills along with strong analytical and numerical capability§ §At least 1 year or more working in an insurance, banking or consulting environment.§ §Completed 2 or more exams.§ §Demonstrated problem solving and passionate to come up with innovative actuarial solutions§ §Professional written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work with a variety of stakeholders.§ § § § §ABOUT OUR TEAM§Enjoy a competitive salary, and life, trauma and health insurance benefits. You will also get 22 days of annual leave, birthday leave and a volunteer day too. We have a collaborative, motivating and above the line culture at Fidelity Life and offer a range of flexible working options and well-being benefits to suit your lifestyle.§If this sounds like your next role, click APPLY.  Applications close on 5 Nov 2020. §Fidelity Life does not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies and/or search firms. This role is only open to candidates who are eligible to work in New Zealand only. § § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
